description: From Middle French resiler (compare French résilier), from Latin resiliō (“spring back”), from re- (“back”) + saliō (“I jump”).

verbs.description: resile (third-person singular simple present resiles, present participle resiling, simple past and past participle resiled)

entries.meaning: To start back; to recoil; to recede from a purpose.
examples: I once described this rather vulgarly as a Euro-wanking make-work project and I do not resile from that.

entries.meaning: To spring back; rebound; resume the original form or position, as an elastic body.
